elements.name: A8_context
elements.title: Task A8
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Camille Hahn performance shows a lot of inconsistency. She didn't perform well on the given tasks and goals. There were times that she had a stellar performance. We believe that she has potential to do better in the future.

Green Elephant
Camille's performance is very inconsistent. While she has moments of stellar work, she generally did not meet goals but has the potential to do better.


Blue Whale
Camille: Performance inconsistent. Didn't meet goals, but showed stellar moments. Potential to improve.


Golden Fish
Camille Hahn's performance is inconsistent. While she occasionally excels, her overall task completion and goal attainment are poor. We believe she has potential for improvement.


Red Panda
Camille Hahn's performance is inconsistent—she struggled with tasks and goals but showed occasional strong results. She has potential for improvement in the future.

elements.name: A11_context
elements.title: Task A11
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Alina's work for this project was not as good as her previous work, however, it is still very much usable. Alina's work in the past has been remarkable- she pays close attention to detail, triple checks her work, and always makes sure her work is as clear and concise as it can be. I always look forward to working with Alina, because her work is, as I stated before, quite well put together.

Golden Fish
While usable, Alina's recent work was not up to her usual remarkable standard. She is typically a detail-oriented and highly-valued collaborator.


Red Panda
Alina: Current project work usable but not as good as remarkable past work (detail-oriented, clear, concise). Always look forward to working with her.


Blue Whale
Alina's recent work, while usable, wasn't her usual remarkable standard. She typically excels in detail, accuracy, and clarity. Her past work is consistently well-regarded.


Green Elephant
Alina's current work, while not up to her usual exceptional standard, remains usable. Her past performance has been outstanding—detailed, thorough, and clear. She consistently delivers high-quality work, and collaborating with her is always a pleasure.

elements.title: Please select the correct statement
elements.description: ORIGINAL: The sun appears to rise each morning from the eastern horizon before setting in the west

choices.text: The moon rises in the east.
The sun rises in the west.
The sun rises in the east.

elements.name: A2_context
elements.title: Task A2
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Bethany Cunningham is driven, takes pride in good-quality work, and shows clear growth potential.

Golden Fish
Bethany, your drive and the immense pride you take in producing high-quality work are outstanding. You consistently demonstrate clear potential for growth, and we are excited to support your continued development.


Blue Whale
Bethany, you demonstrate strong drive and consistently take pride in delivering high-quality work. Your commitment to excellence is evident, and we see clear potential for continued growth. Keep leveraging your dedication; we value your contributions and look forward to your continued development.


Green Elephant
Bethany consistently demonstrates a strong drive to excel, evident in her commitment to producing high-quality work. Her meticulous approach and dedication to excellence are commendable. She also shows clear potential for growth, readily embracing new challenges and developing her skills. We're excited to support her continued development and see her take on more responsibilities.


Red Panda
Bethany Cunningham is a motivated and dedicated employee who consistently takes pride in delivering high-quality work. She demonstrates a strong work ethic, a commitment to excellence, and shows clear potential for continued growth within the organization. Her proactive attitude and attention to detail make her a valuable team member.

elements.name: A3_context
elements.title: Task A3
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Wade Stanley is repeatedly late, hostile, and under-performing—disciplinary action now likely.

Golden Fish
Wade, your repeated lateness, hostile behavior, and continued under-performance are unacceptable and violate our standards. This formal warning outlines that disciplinary action is now the immediate next step.


Red Panda
Wade, your repeated tardiness, displays of hostility, and sustained under-performance are serious concerns. This behavior is unacceptable and negatively impacts the team. Immediate and sustained correction is required. Formal disciplinary action is now likely unless significant improvement is demonstrated without delay.


Blue Whale
Wade's consistent tardiness significantly impacts team productivity and meeting schedules. His interactions have frequently been perceived as uncooperative, creating a challenging team dynamic. Furthermore, his work output consistently falls below expected standards. These ongoing issues necessitate immediate improvement, and disciplinary action is now being considered to address these serious concerns.


Green Elephant
Wade Stanley has consistently demonstrated poor punctuality, unprofessional behavior, and subpar performance. Despite previous feedback, there has been no improvement. Disciplinary action is now likely to address these ongoing concerns and uphold team standards.

elements.name: A13_context
elements.title: Task A13
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: Elliot is fairly effective at managing his workload. He has been a consistent team member. Though, he has not sought help to achieve better results. He needs initiative to become one of our rising stars.

Green Elephant
Elliot is a steady and reliable contributor whose work is effective. This feedback implies that to advance and be seen as a "rising star," he must demonstrate more proactivity. Elliot can grow by identifying a process improvement to propose and by asking his manager for more challenging assignments.


Red Panda
The feedback means Elliot consistently delivers work but hasn't proactively sought help for improvement. This implies reliability is recognized, yet initiative is needed to advance. To grow, Elliot should: 1) Schedule monthly check-ins with his manager to discuss goals, 2) Identify one skill to develop next quarter and request resources, 3) Propose one small process improvement idea by month-end.


Golden Fish
Elliot, your manager sees you as a consistent and effective team member who manages his workload well. However, they've noticed you haven't proactively sought help to improve your results, which is holding you back from being a "rising star." To address this, Elliot should: 1) Identify specific areas for improvement in his work. 2) Schedule a meeting with his manager to discuss these areas and ask for guidance or resources. 3) Proactively seek feedback from peers or mentors on how to enhance his contributions. 4) Take initiative on a new project or responsibility that aligns with his growth goals.


Blue Whale
Elliot consistently manages his workload and contributes reliably to the team, showing solid performance. However, to grow into a rising star, he needs to proactively seek support and opportunities for improvement. This feedback suggests potential for advancement if initiative is strengthened. Elliot should: (1) schedule regular check-ins with his manager to discuss goals, (2) ask for feedback proactively, (3) identify one process to improve and propose a solution, and (4) collaborate more with high-performing peers to learn new approaches.

elements.name: A16_context
elements.title: Task A16
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: Noah is a really key member to have on our team and I am grateful for all the ways in which he steps up to deliver high quality work for our clients. For example, he's always the first to volunteer for assignments. He's always the last one to leave the office, since he's so committed to reviewing reports and double checking his work in a painstaking way. I can certainly see Noah's dedication as an asset in a manager role in the future. However, I don't see him reaching the director level since he is somewhat abrasive in his communication skills.

Blue Whale
Noah is a dedicated, key team member with management potential, but his abrasive communication style is a significant barrier to director-level roles. To improve, Noah can request specific feedback on his communication style and practice active listening in discussions to be more receptive.


Green Elephant
The feedback means Noah’s diligence and client focus make him management material, but abrasive communication may limit director prospects. This signals strength in execution over strategic influence. Noah should: 1) Take an active listening workshop by Q3, 2) Request quarterly feedback on communication tone, 3) Practice rephrating critical feedback neutrally before sharing.


Red Panda
Noah's manager values his dedication, high-quality work, and willingness to take on assignments, seeing him as a strong candidate for a manager role. However, his "abrasive" communication style is noted as a barrier to reaching a director level. To address this, Noah should seek feedback on specific instances of abrasive communication, practice active listening and empathetic responses, and consider communication workshops or coaching to refine his interpersonal skills.


Golden Fish
Noah’s dedication, initiative, and meticulous work quality make him a valuable team member and a strong candidate for a future managerial role. His commitment to excellence is evident in how he consistently volunteers for assignments and ensures accuracy through thorough review. However, advancement to the director level may be limited by his abrasive communication style, which could hinder collaboration and leadership effectiveness. To grow into higher-level leadership, Noah should focus on refining his interpersonal skills. Recommended actions include: 1) seeking feedback on communication from peers and supervisors, 2) attending a workshop on emotional intelligence or constructive communication, 3) practicing active listening in team settings, and 4) working with a mentor to develop a more inclusive and empathetic leadership style.
